text:
Bulmer's tree frog ("Ranoidea bulmeri") is a tree frog from Papua New Guinea. Scientists found it in the mountains between 1500 and 2000 meters above sea level. It does not live in many places.
This frog has a dark stripe behind its eye. The stripe goes down its body on each side. It sometimes has yellow coloring on its throat and chest.
In the local language, this frog is called "kogop".
